intro: Palicourea crocea var. tenuifolia, commonly known as slender leaf palicourea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species with ornamental and medicinal value. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. Its foliage and flowers are often used in traditional herbal medicine for their purported health benefits.
